data.text:
Student Handbook: Bullying and Cyber-Bullying

Policy Rating

Yellow

Speech Code Category

Bullying Policies

Last Updated

August 22, 2023

Bullying and cyber-bullying are prohibited. Bullying is defined as the repeated use of a written, verbal or electronic expression or a physical act or gesture or any combination which is directed at a victim and: (i) causes physical or emotional harm to…

Student Handbook: Student Conduct & Social Responsibility- Discriminatory Harassment

Policy Rating

Yellow

Speech Code Category

Harassment Policies

Last Updated

August 22, 2023

Discriminatory harassment is unwelcome verbal, written, or physical conduct that is discriminatory on the basis of age, race, color, ethnicity, national origin/ancestry, religion, sex or gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, genetic information, or veteran status/membership in the uniformed…

Student Handbook: Social Events- Advertising of Student Social Events

Policy Rating

Yellow

Speech Code Category

Posting and Distribution Policies

Last Updated

August 22, 2023

Smith College prohibits promotion and/or marketing of alcoholic beverages or marijuana on campus and social events that encourage drinking, drunkenness or any type of inebriation as themes. The advertisement of such events is not permitted. Advertisements with language or illustrations that depict…

Student Handbook: Smith College Technology Policies- Acceptable Use of Computer Resources

Policy Rating

Yellow

Speech Code Category

Internet Usage Policies

Last Updated

August 22, 2023

Electronic Communications Restrictions: ... Use of images or text that are abusive, profane, or obscene in e-mail or on web pages.

Student Handbook: Student Conduct & Social Responsibility- Conduct that Threatens or Endangers a Person

Policy Rating

Yellow

Speech Code Category

Harassment Policies

Last Updated

August 22, 2023

Physical abuse, verbal abuse, threats, intimidation, harassment, coercion and other conduct which threatens or endangers the health or safety of any person or which unreasonably interferes with, impedes or harasses other students in the pursuit of their education. Such conduct may occur…
